Target: An ontology developed for goal-based agent operation.

Comment: A goal is a desire (as defined in BDI architecture) that is assigned for active pursuit by one agent.
A collection of individual goals for active pursuit by the agent.
A plan is a sequence of actions that an agent can perform to pursure the goal.
A plan that can be adopted to optimise a chemical reaction.
A step is an action unit that can be taken during pursuit of a goal.
A step represents the design of experiment.
A step represents the reaction experiment execution.
A step represents the post processing of experiment results.
Resource limitations for the pursuit of a goal set.
A placeholder instance to refer to the actual value obtained for a goal during pursing it.
A relation between a goal set and individual goal it consists of.
A relation between a goal set and the restriction posed for the pursuit process.
A relation between a goal and the target value it desires.
A relation between a goal and the target value it desires to be greater than.
A relation between a goal and the target value it desires to be less than.
A relation between a goal and the values is achieved during the pursuit.
A relation between a goal and the plan that can be adopted to achieve it.
A relation between a plan and each step it consists of.
A relation between two sequential steps within a plan.
A relation between a step and the agent that capable of performing it.
A relation between a result and the actual value it refers to.
Allowance of cycles during pursuit of a goal set.
Deadline for the pursuit of a goal set.
